message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.MA

The paper presents a framework for simulating SIR processes on networks, which is a topic related to social networks and epidemiology. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). The paper also discusses source detection and vaccination strategies, which are related to network science and optimization, making cs.SD (Software Development) and cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) likely sub-categories as well. The use of Markov Chain Monte Carlo methods and direct sampling suggests a focus on computational methods, making cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) a possible sub-category. Finally, the analysis of expected propagation time between all pairs of nodes suggests a focus on mathematical modeling, making cs.MA (Mathematical Software) a possible sub-category as well.
